snippet: With Albany emerging in the last two years as a key hub for shipping oil from North Dakota to refineries along the East Coast, state regulators conducted a series of inspections to increase rail safety.
abstract: Gov Andrew M Cumo says New York State regulators conducted series of inspections at Port of Albany and on rail tracks in Albany and Buffalo to increase safety of surging oil-by-rail business; Albany has emerged as key hub for shipping oil from North Dakota to refineries along East Coast.
lead_paragraph: With Albany emerging in the last two years as a key hub for shipping oil from North Dakota to refineries along the East Coast, state regulators conducted a series of inspections to increase rail safety.

headline.main: Rail Inspections Ramp Up in Albany and Buffalo
headline.print_headline: Rail Inspections Ramp Up in Albany and Buffalo
